---
layout:         post-mbed-org
title:          "NEW NFC Stack for mbed"
date:           2012-06-13T08:18:04.000Z
author:         Amit Naran
tags:           NFC, NFCLamp
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/NEW-NFC-Stack-for-mbed/
---

<p>NFC is one of the hottest technology topics around around at the moment,
  throw in Android and now you should definitely be interested! We&apos;ve
  seen banks stumble over each other to be the first to offer NFC-enabled
  services, and now smart posters are becoming more prevalent in bus shelters
  begging to deliver you more content by fist pumping your smartphone at
  it. You&apos;ve seen the technology in action, now it&apos;s time to get
  prototyping for yourself.</p>
<p>
  <img src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/anaran/x_scaled_170px-nfc-n-mark-logo.png.pagespeed.ic.EIoNXi3cCI.png"
  alt="NFC" title="NFC">
</p>
<p><span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/AppNearMe/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/AppNearMe/"> AppNearMe Official</a></span></span>of
  NFC Technology company, <a href="http://www.appnearme.com/" rel="nofollow">AppNearMe</a>,
  has developed a &#xB5;NFC Stack for mbed targeting the NXP PN532 NFC Controller.
  The stack allows you to build your own NFC-enabled hardware and interface
  the AppNearMe framework for Android devices, allowing you to focus on building
  your feature-rich app that compliments your device.</p>
<p>
  <img src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/AppNearMe/x_scaled_adafruitpn532bob.jpg.pagespeed.ic.5-UbwAkQ48.jpg"
  alt="Adafruit PN532" title="Adafruit PN532">
</p>
<p>You can find out more on the <a href="/handbook/NFC">NFC Cookbook page</a> and
  the <a href="/cookbook/munfc-stack">&#xB5;NFC Stack library page</a>, including
  a <a href="/cookbook/PN532-Breakout-Board">tutorial</a> to get started using
  the Adafruit PN532 Breakout Board and a teardown of the <a href="/cookbook/NFCLamp">NFCLamp</a> to
  give you some ideas about the platform in action.</p>
<div class="flex-video">
  <iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Qr03kjG4DnA"
  frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
</div>
